result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Michael J. Dettlaff was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

02:44 PM Defendant Michael J. Dettlaff in court.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Motion has been filed by Mr. Dettlaff.  Motion to reinstate drivers license.  Arguments presented by def.  Ex. # 1 - Letter from DOC regarding community service hours.  Submitted by def to support motion.  State request court deny motion, arguments presented.  Additional statement by def.  Court will deny motion however if def can provide authority court will reconsider.  Denied without prejudice.  Court will not charge sentence.  Exhibit 1 received by court.

State's Argument for Denial of Defendant's Motion for New Trial

Defendant Michael J. Dettlaff in court with attorney Angela Dawn Henderson.  Defendant Michael J. Dettlaff in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 1:34 p.m. Motion for new trial. Statement by Atty Henderson. Atty Tom Roley duly sworn on oath, testifies. Atty Henderson questions Def regarding atty/client privilege. Court finds Def has knowingly and voluntarily waived atty/client confidentiality privilege. Atty Roley continues testimony.  J.M. duly sworn on oath. At request of State, Court advises witness of possible perjury penalties. J.M.  testifies. State requests copies of emails between witness and Atty Henderson. Response by Atty Henderson. Statement by the Court. State withdraws request at this time, but advises may want in the future. Court questions witness. State questions witness. Court will allow written arguments. Atty Henderson to mail arguments by 1/29/16 and fax copy to State at same time, 2 page limit. Discussion regarding emails. State's written arguments due by 2/5/16.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael J. Dettlaff in court, in custody with attorney Thomas Clinton Roley.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls @ 1:44 pm.  Court has reviewed letter from defense.  This is an OWI 8th offense.  State gives sentencing recommendation is 10 years, 5 years prison, & 5 years extended supervision. State gives defendant past history. BAC. 312, State gives argument. J.M. gives statement.  Court has reviewed J.M. letter. L.M. gives statement.  E.B. gives statement. Def. makes statement & argument.  Atty Roley gives argument. 
Court orders on ct 1 9 years prison, 4 years initial confinement, 5 years extended supervision,  Absolute Sobriety, No presence in taverns, Completion of AODA & counseling 200 hrs of community service, 36 months  revocation, retroactive to Admin Susp, 1year IID, upon application, 3976.00 includes DNA Surcharge,  108 days credit on prison sentence,  Prison sentence is consecutive to any other sentence, 
Def. is not eligible for Challenge Program, Def. is eligible for Substance Abuse, Court goes over Written Determination. Def. advised of postconviction rights. Court goes over firearm & voting rights.  ct 2 Dismissed. 
14TR855 Dismissed.
unsigned-Operating While Intoxicated

State's Ex # 1 - Sleeve Containing 2 discs
State's Ex # 2 - Blood Draw Form and Test Results
State's Ex # 3 - Statement of Qualification of Billie Robbins
Stip and Order for Return of Exhibits
and Peremptory Challenges
Clerk's Minutes filed.

Defendant Michael J. Dettlaff in custody, in court with attorney Thomas Clinton Roley.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  9:22 am/All prospective jurors sworn.  Voir dire begins.  10:04 am/Jury selected, sworn and taken to jury room.  Balance of jurors excused.  10:08 am/Recess  10:36 am/Jury returns.  Court gives jury opening instructions.  10:48 am/States gives opening statement.  10:51 am/Def.'s Atty. gives opening statement.  10:59 am/Court gives instruction regarding opening statements.  11:00 am/Deputy Brian Lenzner, duly sworn on oath, testifies.  St. Ex. 1 - Sleeve containing two discs, one of which will be shown to the jury.  No objection by Def.'s Atty.  St. Ex. 1 admitted.  St. Ex. # 2 - Blood Draw Form  with Test results.  Ex # 2 offered by State.  No objection.  Received by court.  11:48 am/Billie Robbins, Wisconsin State Crime Lab, dulty sworn on oath, testifies.  St. Ex. 3 - Statement of Qualifications of Billie Robbins.  Parties stipulate witness is an expert.  St. Ex. 3 offered and admitted.  11:56 am/Deputy Brian Lenzner, still under oath, resumes witness stand.  11:57 am/State rests.  Jury taken to jury room.  Def.'s Atty. makes motion that State has not met their burden.  Motion denied by Court.  11:59 am/Recess.  1:27 pm/Reconvene, jury returns.  J.M., duly sworn on oath, testifies.  2:09 pm/M.S., duly sworn on oath, testifies.  2:16 pm/Recess  2:25 pm/Reconvene, jury returns.  Michael Dettlaff, duly sworn on oath, testifies.  2:50 pm/Jury taken to jury room.  Discussion in regard to testimony about prior offenses and condition of probation.  Court finds Def.'s testimony opens door to cross-examination in regard to prior offenses.  Brief recess.  3:06 pm/Back on the record.  All parties present.  Counsel have reached stipulation as to questions and answer in regard to prior offenses.  Court finds questions are in scope of cross-examination.  3:08 pm/Jury returns.  Testimony of Def. continues.  Side bar with counsel & Judge.  3:36 pm/Defense rests.  Jury taken to jury room.   Recess.  4:12 pm/Reconvene.  Court puts jury instructions and the order in which they will be read on the record along with verdicts.  Attorneys have copies and have no objections to instructions or the order.  Jury returns.  Court gives jury instructions.  4:31 pm/Closing argument by State.  4:54 pm/Closing argument by Def.'s Atty.  5:11 pm/Rebuttal argument by State.  5:16 pm/Court gives jury final instructions.  Bailiff sworn.  Jury taken to jury room.  Exhibits will not go to jury unless they ask for them.  5:18 pm/Recess.  6:08 pm/Reconvene.  Jury present.  Jury has reached a verdict.  Court reads verdicts - OWI/guilty, PAC/guilty.  Court polls jury.  Court excuses jury.  State moves for entry of judgment on verdict.  No objection by Def.'s Atty.  Judgment entered.  Sentencing set for 11-26-14/1:00 p.m.  Counsel will provide Court with sentencing memorandums.  Bond revoked, Def. remanded to custody of the Sheriff.
and verdict forms - State's
with PAC citation
for discovery and demand for inspection

Defendant Michael J. Dettlaff in court with attorney Thomas Clinton Roley.   Ralph Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls @ 8:38 am.  State is ready to proceed.  Deputy Brian Lenzner, Langlade County Sheriff Dept, duly sworn on oath, testifies.  Parties have stipulation that has 7 prior convictions.  Court will accept stipulation.  Court finds probable cause & binds over.  Information Filed.  Atty Roley has copy of information, waives reading & enters not guilty plea.  Court accepts not guilty plea.  Atty Roley questions bond.  Bond remains.  14TR855 Court will amend plaintiff agency to County of Langlade & will continue to follow criminal case.
Bail/Bond
Clerk's Minutes filed.
